title: Euro 2020: Lineker, Shearer & Jenas discuss the Raheem Sterling penalty incident
description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Jermaine Jenas & Alan Shearer discuss the penalty that resulted in Harry Kane converting the winning goal against Denmark, with Shearer calling the penalty 'soft'.

title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate as Three Lions make final
description: England fans celebrate beating Denmark 2-1 in extra time at Euro 2020 to set up a final against Italy.

title: England into Euros final: Declan Rice learns of new niece moments after win
description: Imagine having a baby at the same moment Harry Kane scores the winning goal to reach the Euro 2020 final?

title: England reach Euro 2020 final: How Three Lions victory unfolded on social media
description: England beat Denmark 2-1 to reach the final of Euro 2020 - and here's how the match unfolded on social media.

title: How de-cluttering grew Facebook Marketplace to 1bn users
description: As Covid shut charity shops thrifty second-hand traders shifted online to bag a bargain, in droves.

title: South China Sea: The battle for Scarborough Shoal
description: The BBC's Howard Johnson gained rare access to a disputed coral reef called Scarborough Shoal.

title: Buckingham Palace gardens will open to public
description: The garden at Buckingham Palace will open to the public from Friday 9 July until Sunday 19 September.

title: Eleventh night bonfires getting ready in NI
description: Hundreds of bonfires are being built in Northern Ireland as part of traditional commemorations.

title: Euro 2020 England 2-1 Denmark: Ecstatic Gareth Southgate leads England celebrations at raucous Wembley
description: Watch as Gareth Southgate and the England team national team celebrate with a raucous Wembley crowd, sharing a rendition of 'Sweet Caroline' after beating Denmark 2-1 to advance to the Euro 2020 final.

title: Southgate 'so pleased for our country' as England reach first major men's final since 1966
description: England manager Gareth Southgate says he is "so pleased for our country" after booking their place in the Euro 2020 final.

title: Euro 2020 semi-final England 2-1 Denmark: Harry Kane hits winner as Three Lions reach final
description: Battling England come from behind to beat Denmark after extra time on a truly memorable night at Wembley and reach a first major men's tournament final for the first time since 1966.

title: Watch it again: England v Denmark highlights
description: Watch highlights as captain Harry Kane's follow up from a penalty miss sends England through to their first major men's final since 1966, beating Denmark 2-1 after extra time at Wembley.

title: Euro 2020 England 2-1 Denmark: Mikkel Damsgaard's 'delightful' free-kick gives Denmark lead
description: Mikkel Damsgaard beats goalkeeper Jordan Pickford with a sensational free-kick to put Denmark 1-0 up against England in their semi-final tie at Wembley.

title: World's tallest sandcastle built in Denmark
description: Standing at higher than 21m in the Danish town of Blokhus, it is even decorated with Covid particles.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Djokovic roars, celeb spotting & banana mind games - day nine best bits
description: Watch the best bits from day nine of Wimbledon including the men's quarter-finals, a host of famous faces on centre court and some "banana mind games".

title: England v Denmark: Atomic Kitten star on viral song Southgate You're The One
description: Natasha Hamilton belts out the updated version of hit song Whole Again for the BBC's Ben Brown.

title: Peter R de Vries: The Dutch crime reporter who defied death threats
description: Hailed as a national hero, Peter R de Vries spent decades investigating the criminal underworld.

title: Gareth Southgate: What's it like to have him as your manager?
description: From shooting hoops to giving one-on-one pep talks, we hear about the England manager's style.

title: Right to repair movement gains power in US and Europe
description: Lawmakers and advocates want to give consumers more choice when it comes to fixing devices.

title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Two players isolating after member of management tests positive
description: Two British and Irish Lions players are isolating after a member of the management team tests positive for coronavirus.

title: Covid: Millions could be self-isolating between now and 16 August
description: BBC analysis shows more than 4.5 million people could be asked to self-isolate before 16 August.

title: Haiti President Jovenel Moïse killed in attack at home
description: Jovenel Moïse is shot dead and the first lady injured by gunmen in the capital, Port-au-Prince.

title: South Africa's match against Georgia cancelled over Covid-19 cases
description: South Africa's match against Georgia is cancelled because of Covid-19 cases in both teams, less than three weeks before the Springboks face the British and Irish Lions.

title: England v Denmark: Euro 2020 semi-final a 'win-win for us'
description: Danish fans living in England hope their team can overcome the home side - or do they?

title: Warnings of staff shortages due to self-isolation
description: Business groups say the delay in easing self-isolation rules will hit firms that rely on young workers.

title: Ever Given: Ship that blocked Suez Canal sets sail after deal signed
description: The megaship Ever Given is finally leaving the Suez Canal after a deal is struck with Egypt.

title: Cannes Film Festival rolls out red carpet again after year off
description: Stars and photographers cram the red carpet for the first major film festival since the pandemic.

title: Rebekah Vardy gets partial win in Coleen Rooney libel battle
description: A judge throws out some of Coleen Rooney's defence in the latest stage of the libel battle.

title: England v Denmark: Euro 2020 semi-final advice from former Three Lions to current players
description: What is it like playing in a semi-final of a major tournament for England? Former players give their advice.

title: Dilip Kumar: Legendary Indian actor dies at 98
description: The veteran actor was admitted to hospital after he complained of breathlessness.

title: Who are the players in England's new 18-man ODI squad?
description: The potential debutants, the familiar faces, the big opportunities. Who are the 18 players in England's new squad to face Pakistan?

title: Lady Lavinia Nourse: Ex-High Court judge widow in 'anonymity until charge' call
description: Lady Lavinia Nourse calls her two-week historical child sex abuse trial an "absolute nightmare".

title: Euro 2020: Italy beat Spain on penalties after Morata miss
description: Watch the dramatic penalty shootout which saw Italy beat Spain 4-2 after their high-quality semi-final finished 1-1 in the semi-finals of the European Championship at Wembley.

title: Record June temperatures point to more 'extraordinary' extremes
description: North America experienced its warmest June on record and experts say the figures are frightening.

title: Wembley park stabbings: Nicole and Bibaa's mother 'has no peace' after murder conviction
description: Mina Smallman says the man who murdered her daughters, Nicole and Bibaa, has "no power in our lives".

title: Euro 2020: England manager Gareth Southgate says he is only focused on semi-final against Denmark
description: England manager Gareth Southgate tells BBC Radio 5 Live's Emma Saunders he is solely focused on the semi-final against Denmark.

title: England v Denmark: Who made your England XI for semi-final against Denmark?
description: BBC Sport readers pick their starting XI for England's Euro 2020 semi-final against Denmark.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Isolation insanity' and 'Beer we go' as England awaits
description: The papers consider the risks of extending isolation rules for the fully vaccinated as Euros fever builds.

title: Russia hacking claims pose challenge for Biden
description: After a string of Russian-linked hacks, how will US President Joe Biden respond?

title: Big stars to play small shows as live music returns
description: Sir Tom Jones, Rag 'n' Bone Man and Sam Fender will all play grassroots venues over the summer.

title: Government must clearly communicate Covid rule changes, say psychologists
description: Using nuanced language, acknowledging uncertainty and being empathetic are vital, a study suggests.
